reviews.review_text: Ive always thought this restaurant seemed fun and got to give it a try today. The wooden interior is cozy and I feel like the decor is evoking a little bit genuine nostalgic feel and also a little humour. Our waiter was super nice and the other staff was also friendly. Walking to the washroom takes you right past the kitchen, which is interesting to take a look at but also may give some peace of mind that you can easily see exactly whats going on in there. Their menu is mostly the basic Thai dishes that you see at casual Thai restaurants in Canada, but I was really curious about their take on fish & chips and poutine, which sounded very unique compared to both other Thai food and the Canadian versions of these dishes. So this time I tried Bobs Fish & Chips: fried battered cod pieces topped with sliced mango, onion, basil, and chilies with two crispy curry rice cakes, in a tangy sauce. Its not a dish youd recognize as fish & chips without the context, but I can see where the inspiration was drawn from. I thought it was really tasty! The vinegar sauce was zippy and refreshing and I really liked the flavour and crunchy crust of the rice balls. When I first got a look at it I was skeptical that it was really enough food to be worth $22, but the way they stacked the fish pieces was deceiving because there was actually a lot of fish, and I was fully satiated after finishing. I also tried their house tamarind ginger soda which was very good too! I was expecting it to be spicy like ginger beer and it was really mostly sweet because the tamarind is more pronounced than the ginger, but still a tasty and refreshing drink. My friend got the Chicken Cashew Nut for her meal and enjoyed it as well. There was enough that she ate only half and saved the rest (although shes not a big eater - I think with my appetite I couldve finished it or nearly finished it but been very full). Id say its a safe bet for standard downhome Thai food, and if you want to get a little experimental, the Fish & Chips is definitely worth trying. The positive atmosphere ties it all together.

Awesome spot on Main Street for Thai food! Ordered the Pad Thai, Drunken Noodles with Prawns, and Tom Yum Soup. Both noodles were very flavourful and the soup was the perfect balance of sour and spicy. All dishes had a good serving of prawn which were well sized. Also had a Thai iced tea which was refreshing and was the perfect level of sweetness. Service was also amazing - they were attentive, responsive, and quick to do the small things like remove chopstick/straw wrap from the table and bring take out containers. I definitely recommend Bob Likes Thai Food, and will go again!

Love this hole in the wall ma and pa Thai restaurant. You walk in an immediately feel like you re gonna have a a great authentic and rustic experience of Thai. I got the pad Thai and drunken noodles absolutely loved them! Service was impeccable they have earned themselves a regular customer for life!

A great go to for Thai food. Very authentic! This time we ordered pad Thai, papaya salad, fish and chips, Tom ka ga, and the poutine. All amazing. Good service in a casual relaxed setting. Also if you have a peanut allergy, they are really great about accommodating it. Dietary restrictions: Accommodated peanut allergy by removing it from the dish

The staffs are very accommodating and friendly. I supposed to take out my order but decided to dine-in instead and the staffs even really cool with that. Even gave me a plate and water I noticed as well that people come and go for food pick-ups so their foods are really I ordered pad thai and requested to remove sprouts and add more peanuts. They really served as requested!

Thai cuisine here is extremely tasty! We tried the dragon noodles and the poutine which consisted of taro chips topped with green curry sauce and small fried tofu pieces. The dishes were truly authentic and had amazing flavors. This is definitely my favorite Thai restaurant in Vancouver, without a doubt. All the dishes were well-seasoned and bursting with flavor. I plan on returning to sample other items on the menu!

I dont hand out five stars that easily. They need to be earned or something needs to be special about a place. We go to restaurants for food, to eat. But along the way, we would like a little bit of service. And thats where Bob Likes Thai Food gets top marks. The young man serving our table, recently moved to Canada only a few months ago from Thailand. His service was friendly, outgoing and impeccable. He was patient and gave us so much time, not rushing us. Even when he was clearing up plates from our table and people at my table were speaking with him, he put the plates back down and listened like he really wanted to hear what we were saying. All the other staff that we interacted with in the restaurant from the server to the dishwasher where also amazing. Nice environment. Well done. Oh and by the way, the food was great. Drunken prawns noodle dish all the way. Vegetarian options: There are vegetarian options available. Parking: Free two hour parking and laneway parking. Wheelchair accessibility: Seems to be okay.
Love this place, food is good, servers are friendly, better to go early, getting packed later at night.

Bob likes thai food is definitely a hidden gem! I ordered the lunch special green curry for $15 and it was delicious! At first, i thought the green curry portion was quite small, but the bowl is actually quite deep and held a lot of the green curry sauce. The bowl also had generous portions of tender chicken and eggplant. The eggplant was scrumptious as they grilled it prior to putting it in the green curry sauce. The staff here are also really nice, which gives this place a nice homey vibe. Would definitely be back!

Opted to order the Something which was a great decision. Giving the chefs the opportunity to cook what they want is a win win for everyone involved. This time, it was a Peking duck style pork belly - which was fantastic. My friends opted for a noodle dish and the massaman curry. Both were flavorful and filling. While all the food was great - the service was the real standout. Everyone was friendly and charming. The banter from one specific server elevated the experience entirely. Altogether, cant recommend it enough.
Cute family run Thai restaurant. Lunch deal is pretty decent!

Love the loaded with shrimp pad Thai. I do notice they are adding Thai touches to some classics like fish and chips and even poutine! I have not ventured into this territory yet but will try someday. The environment is cozy, I do wish they had some colour as all very beige.  I found the place clean and the service efficient and friendly. $$

The Thai restaurant is really authentic. Delicious: recommended shrimp salad, fried tofu must be ordered Service: The service staff is very attentive, will not give you pressure, make people enjoy and comfortable Environment: clean and comfortable!  Easy parking

BOB likes Thai Food is unreal. Staff are super friendly and polite and the food is Bomb! The Pad Thai with Prawn is a classic, but if you wanna spice it up a bit, grab the Massaman beef curry. Take hoo Tod Tofu is a great start, but very filling so be careful.

Jesus, I only just noticed I ve never reviewed this place. Sorry, I love this place and come here every 1 or 2 times biweekly. I love their super spicy Pad Thai, and my kids love their lichee wrapped with bacon and pineapple. What a great combo. I would recommend going with friends so you can order a wide variety of things. Such as the  fish and chips  because this version has gone  Bob  style.  The greater question you should ask them is  who is bob ?

I was craving some Thai food and decided to check this spot out. Overall experience was great, true to its taste! The ladies serving us were friendly and welcoming. We had the Papaya Salad, Penang Curry, Pad Thai & the Tom Kha Gai. All items were very good. The flavours were there and it wasn t shy. We also tried their Thai Milk Tea and the Tamarind Soda, and I think I just found my new favorite drinks.
Very friendly at the cash.  I had eggplant with sweet peppers and onions.  Very tasty with a little spice kick.

Inexpensive place for delicious Thai food. Came here for lunch and we both ordered items off the lunch menu which was good value. The miang kham was a flavourful appetizer which left us wanting more. My green curry was a medium level of spiciness without overwhelming the green curry flavour. Service was fairly friendly & efficient but they could have used with one more server as they seemed rushed. Id definitely visit this place again.
Great Thai food. Good size servings.

Tastes exactly like how it does in Thailand, I missed their food so much. And the Thai lady serving us was very direct and quirky. Fast service, great food. I couldnt ask for more. New favorite for me.

Great food and service! I always get the pad thai. I ordered take out koong prah one time and the prawns were half raw in the centre. I called them back and the staff were quick to rectify the situation, offering a sincere apology and a credit for a future visit (which they honoured).
My wife and I tried this cozy Thai place. We tried fish (with tamarind, basil and garlic sauce) and Pad pie king chicken  (chicken with beans). Both dishes were flavorful and the service was great.
Incredible flavours and authentic dishes. My favourite Thai in Vancouver, hands down.

Seriously authentic Thai food! We tried the pad Thai, yellow fish curry, chicken satay, Miang kham for the first time, and the rice pudding and coconut custard dessert. Pad Thai was clean and layered with flavour, the satay was juicy and tender and the yellow curry was very rich and spicy, although I didnt like that the fish was battered in the curry - didnt make sense to me. The Miang kham was incredibly delicious with an explosion of flavours and will not be soon forgotten. And the dessert was delicate and made with love. Every dish was mouthwateringly good! And the service was very friendly and prompt.
They had a little sate stand setup on the street for car free day . I had the pork sage with sticky rice and peanut sauce. Excellent flavour
Its an excellent no fuss place for deliciousThai cuisine. To me, theyre the closest to match the flavor profile of the Thai food I experienced during my travels through Thailand.

I adore this place. Its authentic Thai with the strong flavors you would expect from Thai food. Ive been to other places where the food is kind of watered down and just not flavorful enough but Bob tastes authentic. Its a small and cozy place :)
BROOOO. 5 STARS IN THIS BABY BOOGLE I LOVE *bob loves thai food* IT IS SO GOOD EVEN THOUGH IVE NEVER EVEN EATE HERE :FIRE:
Delicious pad thai.  Only ordered once for delivery and the food was delicious.  Will try to dine in next time!

Wooooooowww the Pad Thai is so good! really enjoyed their food and it was so nice and cozy in here however their bathroom needs a little bit of an upgrade! Customer service was fantastic and didn t rush us out when we hung out for a little longer.
Good and relax atmosphere. Good food and better than other *fake* Thai restaurants

Every dish we have had here have been excellent - flavorful and so fresh! Servers are friendly and awesome, too. Update: we have been coming here at least once a month and I just wanted to add that the food is consistently excellent!
We came here on a whim because we liked the name. We were blown away by how amazing the food is. Phenomenal.
One my favourite thai restaurant in our area in Main st. Vancouver. My favourite dish is prawn pad Thai. So good!
Super delicious. Service very friendly. Feels like in Thailand. We will back for sure.
Straight forward simple and delicious. The drinks are to die for too. Tamarind + ginger & lime + ginger. Bothe we re so good. We got the pad Thai and pad si-ew
We are visiting from Calgary. Nice food. Quick service and reasonable price. Friendly staff too.
Trolls like Thai food!! Wonderful food and prices are fairly reasonable for what you get. You must try the Thai fish and chips. Its something I never had before.
Delicious Thai food and super friendly and accommodating service :) pictured is the Green curry chicken with added veggies and jasmine rice

We popped in after flying in from Edmonton. My fam has eaten a lot of Thai and this was delish. Everyone loved what they got and there wasnt one bite of leftovers. My celiac kiddo loved the green curry.

Legit proper Thai food the flavours and quality are there . Can t beat the lunch special of green curry rice and wontons. Wishing I got full size I want more. The Thai iced tea was so tasty with coconut milk and amazing colour! Khob khun ka
I love the pad si-ew! The flavors were all there and the textures of the choice of veggies goes well with the flat noodles!  Pad Thai was amazing also!

Cosy place. I love the idea of the shared plates (there are also personal plates available). Fresh, stimulating sour tastes. Service was fast for how busy it was. Try to come before the dinner rush but they seem to have a fast turnover rate.
Very good authentic Thai cuisine run by Thai people(Owner, Staff and Chef).I recommended this restaurant for who like Thai cuisine.(I m from Thailand)
Great food, try and get their homemade sodas if they have them I got the drunken noodles and was very happy with my meal
Our favorite thai restaurant. Super good thai food at a reasonable price. Would recommend that appetizer that comes in several small bowls wrapped in some sort of leaf. Sooooo good.
Best Thai restaurant in Vancouver. The portion sizes are incredible and the flavor is amazing. I recommend the roasted duck curry

Whenever we pick up dinner from Bob Likes Thai Food we are always happy. The Pad Thai is always a hit, the spring rolls are a crispy delight and really anything else we try is good. Also leftovers are always delicious even when cold. I would recommend.

I went to Bob Likes Thai Food for the first time a few days ago and I am already craving a return visit. I had the Pad Thai, which was outrageously delicious. The dish is extremely flavorful with the perfect balance of sauce and noodles, and large fresh shrimp. I can t wait to eat there again and try more of their addictive food, probably in the next few days.
Its superb everytime Ive visited. Plus the young thai coconut water is wonderful and makes store bought coconut water substandard once youve had fresh! Definitely go here if you like Thai food!
great little place, delicious Thai food. lunch sets are a good value.
Jordan likes Bob likes Thai Food! (Jordan is deathly allergic to Thai food and hasnt actually ever eaten here) Atmosphere : 5/5
Delicious.  Shared 3 dishes with one friend and took some home, but will return with more people, so we can order more dishes.

I really really like this place. The food is superbly delicious and the pad noodles are ala dente which is a pleasant surprise. Everything taste super fresh and flavourful. I especially enjoy the roast duck red curry. Only downside is the portions are a bit small for what you are paying. 3 dishes costs 60+ and if your famished, it s barely enough.
Its always a great experience to go eat at Bobs. Food is amazing, place always clean and service fantastic
Amazing food. Really fast service and excellent in taste. Would recommend 10/10 times . Great chicken dishes . Pad Thai is the best I ve had in Vancouver.

Tried this place on a whim and it did not disappoint! Small and cosy thai spot with amazing food.    Stepping into the restaurant, you could tell the food was going to be delicious. Really authentic and savoury dishes. Ill definitely be back to try more!
OMG! I just love this place! Such a cool and authentic place! Green curry and chicken cashew nuts and coconut rice are our go to option! Too bad they increased their price like crazy!

Was amazing place for authentic Thai food , was surprised to see variety options and kudos to Chef for making chicken pad Thai so delicious and the aroma of the chicken was so delicious, this place uses authentic ingredients, Was greeted by manager and server with an amazing attitude. Would love to visit this place again, Thanks for entire team

The best Thai restaurant in Vancouver. It s super authentic, reminded me of the times I ve had in Thailand. Their  fish and chips  is incredible! Mind blowing to be more accurate. As a matter of fact calling it  fish and chips  does not do it justice and clearly communicates how delicious and complex it actually is. So many flavours of Thailand packed in one dish.

Honestly your missing out if you havent been here before. I went for the first time last night and I beleive that I have found my new favorite restaurant. Very kind and authentic service, delightful flavors, and the overall essence of the room felt homey and comftorble. Ill be coming back soon!
Yes! This place is as delicious as all the reviews say! I have had a lot of Thai food in my day and Ive never eaten Miang Kham.....it was divine.
Best Thai food Ive ever had! 100% recommend
Amazing Thai curry, awesome and friendly staff. They were really acocomadating to our table for 10.

One of the best Pad Thai that Ive ever had! Great service too!I will definitely be coming back! Great name too! Update: After having gone for pad Thai twice in the same weekend, Im officially addicted. Its all I can think about! :)

Delicious food! My husband and I stopped by to check it out, and were surprised by such a good quality and taste. It looks like a small place from outside, but it s a hidden gem! We had beef curry and pad Thai shrimp! Hope to stop by again! Service was great too, very friendly staff.

Incredible Thai food. Having read the reviews, my expectations were already high coming in. I can say without a doubt that my expectations were exceeded in every way possible. The food was not only colorful and plated with care, but delicious as well, tasting of the characteristic boldness you would expect from great Thai food. The service was friendly and the atmosphere was perfect for a lazy Sunday lunch. Highly suggest this amazing restaurant!

Tried this little place over the weekend and it was awesome!  The service was impeccable and very attentive.  We tried the pad thai, spring rolls and a curry and all were excellent - esp. the pad thai.   The spring rolls were not greasy and the curry not too sweet - just right!  We will definitely be back A+

... And youll love Bob once you come here and try the food! Low-key atmosphere, always bustling, and lots of families and groups of young pretty people, enjoying the amazing food and prime view of Main Street pedestrians. I started eating a certain style of Thai fried rice about 20 years ago, and was very happy that the staff here were willing to customize the dish just the way I liked it. For such a busy  restaurant, I didnt expect them to be able to accommodate it. I understand there is another location too, but I havent tried it yet. Thanks Bob, whoever you are!

Noticed that they had a few vegan options to choose from (not in comparison to the rest of their menu). Ordered their eggplant dish+sticky rice and would definitely order again. Portion sizes are for an individual as I felt satisfied from just the eggplant dish mixed with rice! Would recommend :D
Food and service both amazing ! Will for sure go there again . Plus the name is very catchy
Very delicious curry and noodles! Staff was welcoming.

What a lovely place. The food is delicious. The staff are friendly. It has a nice clean decor. Street parking is readily available, I had no problem. They do charge individually for rice, you cant just get a large one for the table. (and I think the rice portion is pretty small. But honestly, if that is the worst thing to happen it is pretty darn good) I am absolutely going to go back, totally worth it.

Really small place. They have long tables where they sit random people all together, so not an ideal place if you dont like sharing table with strangers. You might need to book a table if you want your privacy. Other than that, the food is amazing. Big portions. They will put the leftovers in a box for you to take home if you cant finish it. Price is pretty affordable. 15-18$ for a big meal. The staff is super friendly and they give lot of info about the menu. Great place.
Great Flavors! Pad thai, green curry and spring rolls were very good!  Love the spiciness levels. Chicken was cooked very well, not dry. Everything Tastes very fresh.

LOVE THIS PLACE. The food is so authentic and delicious. Go for amazing Thai food, you wont regret. The location is nicer on West Broadway, has a more rustic feel. This location could use some interior design love, but doesnt take away from how good the food is.
Great food. Amazing noodles and green curry!

The massaman curry was something special. I also loved the must try, tastes like many things in one bite wrapped-up-in-a-leaf thing they had going on. Service was very attentive. A good experience overall. Its a smaller restaurant, I would say the max table size they can comfortably accommodate would be 8, and reserve ahead if you are above 4

Me and my partner (who lived in Thailand) absolutely love it here. The food is great! Dessert is really nice and interesting too. The woman (may be the owner) is really friendly and knowledgeable. Must go!
Yummy Thai food
The drunken noodles and red curry were both AMAZING!

Today I had the pleasure of having a late lunch at Bob Likes  Thai. I have been let down at some other Thai restaraunts so I wasnt sure what to expect. Well let me tell you! Their green curry is to die for. Finally authentic Thai cuisine. I had a lovely waitress (Kathy? Katie? hope Im not too far off) and service was prompt. Everything starting from the kitchen to the table was excellent. Amazing chefs, amazing servers, will be returning again soon.

Authentic, flavorful dishes. Good service, food came out quickly which was helpful because we have 4 small children. We will definitely be back. Everything was delicious but the massaman beef curry was my favourite.

Small intimate space with  fun atmosphere. I dont typically like small spaces, but was perfectly comfortable. Pad Thai was cooked nicely with delicious flavors. Reasonably priced.Definitely worth a visit!
UNREAL Thai food. They had so much protein in the food, when many restaurants tend to cheap out on this aspect. Dessert was delicious as well. Cheers Bob!
My rice is missing but red curry was nice

Legit best place to ever go we drove over 25 min to pick up our food the COVID protocols I forced are very great safe and I felt safe getting my food what a difference from befor COVID eating here The restaurants ambience was beautiful modern and authentic to its cultures and food After COVID trying many many places in Burnaby and new west nothing has been remotely close to the authentic taste flavours and authenticity of the beautiful aromas and flavours bob likes Thai created The salad is exceptional the food is extremely tasty The spring rolls are bomb the best best spring rolls hands down pad Thai always the best chicken cashew amazing The list can go on I love this place they even use the most authentic ingredients and chillies and flavours are spot on and best Thai food hands down we have tried so many places from Abbotsford to maple ridge to Burnaby vancouver and new west and honestly don t waste your time going any where else Worth the drive wait anything this place is best Thai food ever !!!! Only thing  I was sad about was our Thai milk tea was a little watery and not to sweet as I asked for extra sweet But don t mind food is the best Thai ever !!!!!!!
Really enjoyed the pad thai   great sauce to noodle ratio. The spring rolls / dishes came with several tasty dipping sauces making this a great place for fellow dipping sauce enthusiasts.
Roasted red duck curry is delicious!  Swimming Rama (spinach with peanut sauce and tofu) is really yummy. Classic pad thai. My go-to Thai restaurant!

Delicious Thai food and reggae music. My favorite Thai food in Vancouver. This Broadway location is a bit oddly shaped in that its long and thin. Theyve got some bigger tables, so works for larger groups. The lunch special is a pretty good deal.
Try Pineapple prawns stir fry and Drunken noodles. The best.
Tasty, quick, with a great lunch special! Vegetarian options: Eggplant curry Food : 5/5 |

Not really what we were expecting to find outside of downtown Vancouver but main street is full of wonderful surprises and is definitely the coolest area of the city. The Pad Thai was perfect and probably the best i ve ever had, i then had the Miang Kam which was a wonderful experience, I d seriously recommend trying these when in this place, it was every flavour possible in a single mouthful. The Waitress we had was also really helpful and she clearly cared about the place which is really nice to see. 11/10

Should be Bob Loves Thai because Bob makes it just how i want it.  The panang beef was perfect and the waitress was wonderful.  If you like Pink Pepper in Hollywood, CA you will love Bob Likes Thai Food. in Vancouver  5 star food. Review from 2011.
Great food, wonderful flavours and very helpful staff.  One note, sides of rice should be ordered roughly 2 rice for 3 adults for a reasonable sized meal.  More if your kids are heavy rice eaters.

One of the best thai food restaurants in the city! We will go out of our way just to come here - takeout and eating in are both great options.  Our favourites are the Massman curry, Yellow fish curry and pad thai.  Definitely check this place out, you will not be disappointed!

One of those places you can t change your order because what you get the first time is so insanely good - Pad Si Ew rice noodles with Pork and Gai-Lan, Panang Beef red coconut milk curry with bell peppers, with a side of Jasmine rice - obsessed.
You dont have to listen to me try to dance about architecture or write about great food. Love this place from their Thai standards to their own unique dishes.
Delicious food. Quick service. Really great authentic Thai food.

Really good, authentic, reasonably priced Thai food. Nice clean restaurant and very quick turn around on take out. The main Street location does not have alcohol, but there Broadway location does, FYI.
